Format lake observation data to AEME format

Source: R/lake_obs_to_aeme.R
lake_obs_to_aeme.Rd

Converts a data frame of lake observations into the format required for AEME. The function maps variable names and units to AEME standards using provided lookup tables. It also ensures that required columns are present and correctly named.

Usage

lake_obs_to_aeme(
  data,
  depth_col_name,
  datetime_col_name,
  var_col_name,
  value_col_name,
  lake_id_col,
  var_map
)

Arguments

data

data frame containing lake observations

depth_col_name

column name for depth (m). If missing, the function will attempt to infer it.

datetime_col_name

column name for date/time. If missing, the function will attempt to infer it.

var_col_name

column name for variable names. If missing, the function will attempt to infer it.

value_col_name

column name for variable values. If missing, the function will attempt to infer it.

lake_id_col

column name for lake identifier. If missing, the function assumes all data is for a single lake.

var_map

data frame with columns "var_aeme", "name", and "unit" for mapping variable names and units to AEME standards. "var_aeme" is the defined AEME variable name, "name" is the name used in the input data, and "unit" is the unit used in the input data.

Value

A data frame formatted for AEME with columns "Date", "var_aeme", "depth_from", "depth_to", and "value".

On this page
